City Council
============

City Council
![DSC09855](https://www.navasotatx.gov/City%20council/New%20Council%20Headshots/DSC09855.jpg?t=20250804094846)

The Navasota City Council is the elected body that provides the direction and policy for the City of Navasota. The City of Navasota operates under a Home Rule Charter with a council/manager form of government. There are five elected Council members who serve for alternating three-year terms. Meetings take place on the second and fourth Monday each month at 6:00 p.m. in the City Council Chambers at City Hall. To contact the City Council, please call the City Secretary at (936) 825-6408.

2nd & 4th Mondays of Each Month
City Council Chambers at City Hall, 200 E. McAlpine
6:00 p.m.
To watch the City Council meeting live please visit the City of Navasota’s YouTube here:
City Council Meeting Procedures

* [Ordinance No. 923-20 City Council Meeting Procedures](https://www.navasotatx.gov/City%20council/ORDINANCE%20NO.%20923-20%20-%20CITY%20COUNCIL%20MEETING%20PROCEDURES.pdf?t=20250306101300)

If you would like to speak at a City Council meeting, please fill out the following form and present it to the City Secretary by 5:45p.m. the day of the meeting.

**The role of the City Council is to:**

* Set policy direction for the conduct of the affairs of the City.

The citizens of Navasota elect the five members of the City Council at large. The City of Navasota Charter stipulates that the Council members will vote on which members serve as the Mayor and Mayor Pro-Tem.
The City Council appoints the citizens of Navasota and Grimes County to approximately 90 seats on the advisory boards and commissions. Along with the Council, these board members serve as volunteers and play an important role in shaping the Navasota of tomorrow.
